website_summaries.verdict: These chemical-free warmers are more environmentally friendly, but they also don’t keep feet as warm as other options.
pros: Provide an extra layer of insulation around the toes and the ball of the foot, keeping them warm and comfortable
The neoprene fabric is thin enough to be unobtrusive
cons: The fabric doesn’t wick away moisture, so toes eventually get cold as the user’s socks get damp

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely amazing. I have raynauds and these keep my toes perfectly warm even when I’m seated in a cold room for 5+ hours at a time. They fit well over socks and in shoes. The material is sleek too, similar to insulated under armor material. They are also very comfortable, keeps your feet cozy. 100% recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ashopperonamazon

customer_reviews.title: Keeps toes warm, helps a lot with raynauds suffering in toes.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic!! Fixed my fungua cold toes from raynauds, thank you for selling this on Amazon! You rock seller! :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazonlover2k

customer_reviews.title: These work well and replace costly single-use toe warmers
customer_reviews.text: Only on day two with these, but I'm already ready to leave this positive review! These neoprene toe warmers have done exactly what the costly (and wasteful) Little Hotties do - keep my toes nice and warm! It's nice that the set includes 2 pairs to alternate back & forth between washing/drying. So nice to find something more economical and ecologically correct to help me get through these winter months. Also, had a slight problem with one of the booties and the seller (21Centurysolutions) responded quickly with an acceptable resolution to the problem. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: DobieG

customer_reviews.title: Way better that over-the-shoe type
customer_reviews.text: For years I've been riding in over-the-shoe type neoprene toe covers. And my toes always froze. Just got this pair. Fit inside the shoe perfectly and kept my toes nice and warm, yet breathing. Rode this morning in 30F weather. Single warm sock, in super ventilated mesh summer cycling shoes. Awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Schlemazl Beerbaum

customer_reviews.title: Happy Raynaud's sufferer!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic product for a Raynaud's disease sufferer. They fit easily with socks on in my tennis shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Peedin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but they really keep my toes warm! They are thin enough I can wear them in my shoes. They were a little bigger than I thought they would be so I wear them over my socks. As long as I put them on before my toes get cold my feet dont freeze anymore! I have poor circulation bc of renault's and diabetes and these help me so much that I wear them all the time now! I'm ordering more because two pairs just isnt enough and I want to have extras. My friend is also planning on borrowing mine or getting his own for hunting season.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime L.

customer_reviews.title: I was skiing Whistler /Blackcomb a couple weeks ago, ...
customer_reviews.text: I was skiing Whistler /Blackcomb a couple weeks ago, and my toes were toasty warm the whole time! Temps on the top was 19 deg F -7.2 deg C. Thanks to your product.
customer_reviews.author: william c. haney

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: These are very simple, but very effective. I'm pretty amazed by how much of a difference they made on my bike ride yesterday. It was about 35-40 degrees outside, and I was wearing very ventilated MTB shoes. Normally, my toes are numb after a very short time in those temperatures. With these toe warmers on, my feet still got cold and my toes were numb by the end of my ride, but I was comfortable for way longer than without them. I look forward to pairing these with a set of shoe covers for my next ride. Hopefully, that combo will let me ride comfortably in low temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: andy1

customer_reviews.title: Yes! Keeps toes warmer
customer_reviews.text: My shoe size is 10 wide and size 2 Fits me with a little room to spare. I was actually using old socks, I cut to this shape, before I knew this product existed. I thought I invented a genius new product. This is better than an additional sock layer. It is warmer. It doesn’t add bulk like a second full sock would, possibly restricting circulation. It’s a very good product, but it’s not a miracle. If you have to be outside in temperatures below 40 degrees for any length of time, invest in electric socks and good boots.
customer_reviews.author: Ace Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Must Have for Raynaud’s Sufferers
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I have Raynaud’s and always struggle with keeping my fingers and toes warm during the winter months. I have been wearing these over my socks in tennis shoes daily while training clients and during my own workouts and they have kept my toes warm. I have felt them get cooler as the temperature really dropped a few mornings, but my toes never went numb and I was actually still comfortable. This is the best $13 I’ve spent on products for my Raynaud’s! If you are a sufferer, grab a set of these!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff carroll

customer_reviews.title: These keep my toes warm!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I was recently diagnosed with Raynaud's, so my feet get really cold really fast! I wear them under a thin pair of socks to work so my shoes still fit okay. Since they're like socks, I wash them after every use, so they started to wear out quickly and come apart at the seams... So I bought 2 more pairs. Definitely recommend if you're feet get cold! If you're going to be inside for a while, you'll probably get too hot though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: These things are a damn miracle. I am a hunter and skier. My toes are always cold when I’m skiing and sitting still in a hunting blind is a killer on the toes. Having these was like flipping a switch. No more cold toes! Getting two pairs is cool too. One for you and one for your spouse, friend, or family member. Great gift too for the cold hands warm heart person in your life.
customer_reviews.author: T. W.

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to my cycling gear
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to wear in my sneakers (mesh toe) when riding my bike on colder days. they work surprisingly well at keeping toes warm by blocking wind and retaining residual body heat. They didn't make my toes hot but simply kept them comfortable during 30-45 minute rides in 40-degree temps.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wenrich

customer_reviews.title: I like them
customer_reviews.text: I wear the larger size over my socks inside my running shoes. My toes stay warm in 30 degree temps. Buy the large size if your feet are 9 1/2 or larger. I bought the small size and had to get the large ones, small were too tight. Small might fit a size 9 men's foot. I don't think these will last long, but will not know for months.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Based on the description, I first ordered the larger size. But they were way too big. I returned them and ordered the smaller size. Still too large. And I was wearing them over my socks. I tried them out with my boots hoping they'd stay in place that way, but they were too loose to not move around and get all wonky. They became clumpy in my boots and totally uncomfortable. Bummer because I am one of those folks who has Raynaud's, too, where my toes getting really cold really easily. I had my hopes up about these based on some other reviews, but was totally disappointed. Sent the second pair back as well.
customer_reviews.author: jookie Jill

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I thought they would be a little small for my feet (size 9.5 mens), but they fit well. They aren't breathable and I have feeling back in my toes already. I wore them without socks last night and my feet were fine. Wearing them with socks now and my toes aren't so cold they are numb (like usual).
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ann

customer_reviews.title: For someone whose feet are ALWAYS cold, these toe warmers WORK! 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: These are the best things to use to keep your toes warm! My feet are always cold (even in the summertime!) Before I got these toe warmers, I would ride my bike in 50*F temps and my feet got so cold they were numb. I wore these to ride in 37*F weather and my feet were toasty! Love them!
customer_reviews.author: D. Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: I tried these toe warmers in temperatures in the mid 40s on my 30 mile ride. They did not do the job. They did not keep my toes warm and were ineffective in keeping my feet from sliding in and out of the. I would not purchase these for he purpose of bike riding in winter months.
customer_reviews.author: Will H.

customer_reviews.title: Germany to Iceland, they worked!
customer_reviews.text: We live in Germany and Christmas markets are a big part of their culture. I, however, hate having cold toes! No matter what socks I wear, my toes stay cold. I worried that having these over my toes would feel awkward (I'm a freak about the way my feet feel in my socks/shoes,) but they don't! They were successful at keeping my toes warm, even in Iceland during the winter!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Lockey

customer_reviews.title: Immediate relief!
customer_reviews.text: I saw other reviewers mention these were good for Raynaud's sufferers. They weren't kidding! My toes get so cold I lose blood flow and they get numb. These toe warmers worked like a charm keeping my feet nice and warm during snow vacations. Now, even at work, when my feet get cold, I slip them on and I feel instant relief! They are great!
customer_reviews.author: Yvette M. Cardona

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than those disposable toe warmers
customer_reviews.text: Trying to find something to keep my toes warm in the winter as I horse back ride 4 times a week. I didn't want to spend the money on the disposable toe warmers as that gets expensive fast. I wear wool blend ski socks with these neoprene toe warmers and they work pretty darn well! Every once in awhile i'll get a tad nippy but i still recommend them. I bought the smaller size for my shoe size of 8 and they fit perfect. No pinching on the toes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I wore them under my cycling shoes, and they did help my toes stay warmer. Riding in temp of mid-40s, my feet were mildly uncomfortable with some medium thickness thermal socks, whereas without the neoprene warmers my toes would have been aching bitterly. I was concerned that they might be too thick to fit into my cycling shoes, but that hasn't been a problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: P. T. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much awesome
customer_reviews.text: Oh. My. Gosh. My toes were ALWAYS cold. Wool socks? Still cold. Now, seriously, they're so warm they're sticky and kinda sweaty just sitting here. My only problem was they were too big, but that's my fault not theirs. Update: my toes are sweaty bc the material, not necessarily bc it's warm. BUT my toes are still way warmer than they were without these.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: I get extremely cold feet
customer_reviews.text: I get extremely cold feet and when my feet are cold my whole entire body is cold. I bought these to wear over my socks. My trick is that I buy toe warmers (ex. Hot Hands, Grabbers) and I put them under my sock and then I slip these over them. Works like a charm. Keeps my feet nice and cozy. Only thing is the fit. They slip of fairly quickly if not wearing closed shoes like sneakers. They don’t work too well with slippers. But all in all I liked them.
customer_reviews.author: Malak

customer_reviews.title: Keeps toes warm
customer_reviews.text: They do the job by keeping your toes warm. I run with shoes that have a mesh upper in the toe area so the cold air makes my toes numb, but the toe warmers keep the cold air out. The only issues with them is the threads are starting to unravel along the seams, but otherwise they work just fine. Their cheap enough to just replace them as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ulysses

customer_reviews.title: Bought multiple times
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to keep my feet warm so I could run outside in sub-freezing temperatures last winter. I saw these and thought they looked promising. They were! My toes were never exactly WARM out there, but they definitely weren't cold. Sometimes I wore both pairs at the same time. I bought some for my sister and mom too. Cold toes/feet run in the family.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Great for neuropathy!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely amazing. Do not order them for your shoe size but measure your foot. The customer service is amazing. The product is life-saving for someone with neuropathy. I wear them absolutely every day against my skin and before I put my socks on. and especially to bed I sometimes wear two pairs under my socks.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Moogie

customer_reviews.title: Return product / Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable and don’t work I had high hopes for these but they are so paper thin and seem very cheap,I felt no warmth whatsoever. I put the second pair on top of the first and was slightly better but too thick to be comfortable. They are also too short in length and end on a pressure point on ball of your foot. Disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: PacaCheetah

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these toe warmers but they failed miserably. They failed to stay securely on my feet regardless of the socks and boot combinations I wore and they provided no additional warmth. If you get cold toes these are not the answer look for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Draven

customer_reviews.title: They do almost nothing
customer_reviews.text: I wear these with my Colombia insulated boots and thick wool socks. Yet my toes are still cold! They aren't frozen as they once we're only reason I give this two stars. I even tryed doubling up as there are two pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben D.

customer_reviews.title: If you have cold toes, look no further!
customer_reviews.text: This is a product that is absolutely an A+! I have cold toes, year around, dangerously cold, but, socks are not an option in 95 degree heat. These Neoprene warmers fit over your toes only and STAY PUT, almost amazing. Believe me they keep my toes warn and blood circulating. You can wear alone, under little house slips or closed toe shoes. I am so happy I found them.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah R. Resnick

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: These products definitely help warm feet and toes to an extent but it isn't an astonishing difference. I was concerned they would not fit my feet. I am a size 7 in womens, average width and small to average toes. It actually fit fine! And also fits on my boyfriend's size 11 feet! I tested wearing both under and over my socks and preferred to have these little cappers under my socks.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Where has this been all my life?! I love this product. For someone who's toes are always cold, this is a great, comfortable solution. It did take me about a week to realize that these can be worn UNDER your socks vs. only on top but that's my own mistake :)
customer_reviews.author: Sarah B.

customer_reviews.title: Thin, but warm
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. They are thin enough that they're comfortable inside shoes. I haven't needed to wear them in really cold temps yet, but even inside they've definitely kept my toes warmer. I'll update the review of anything changes after colder temps.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Do not work below 25 degrees
customer_reviews.text: I bike commute year round. The only thing I struggle to keep warm during the winter are my toes. I've tried these below and above 25 degrees. Anything below 25, my toes still got cold, but at a slower rate. After two wears the fabric started to curl at the edges. I'm returning.
customer_reviews.author: nikki newton

customer_reviews.title: My toes no longer freeze when cycling in somewhat cold weather
customer_reviews.text: Went on a 20 mile ride today in 55 degree weather. Before I had these toe warmers, my toes would be freezing at the end of the ride. Today, with these toe warmers, my toes were comfortable. I wish I had discovered these years ago!
customer_reviews.author: M. Huerta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Raynaud’s!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for anyone with Raynaud’s. My toes stay toasty warm all day! I wear them over my socks and can easily slip my feet in my sneakers. No added bulk and they stay put! Love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Austin

customer_reviews.title: Bigggg nope!
customer_reviews.text: Sadley, did not work for me. I have raynauds pretty bad in my hands/feet and was hoping these would help with skiing as past reviewers mentioned. However, they only made my boots tighter and therefore cut my circulation off more. My feet were 2x colder wearing these compared towhen i took them off the second half of the day. Oh well...worth a try!
customer_reviews.author: leah

customer_reviews.title: Great for running in 10 degree weather
customer_reviews.text: On winter mornings in the northern Midwest, even thick wool socks sometimes don't protect the toes, especially in thin running shoes. These were great. They don't have edges that chafe so you don't feel them. You won't notice they're there nor will your toes notice the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: No more cold toes
customer_reviews.text: Love these toe warmers. I work outside year round and with winter at it's peak, these are a toe saver :) They keep my toes nice and warm in my work boots and they don't make my feet sweaty unless the temp hits above 50°. I throw em in the washer with the rest of my laundry, they don't shrink nor do the seams come loose. Excellent quality material. Wish I would have found these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Ann

customer_reviews.title: 1.5mm Thermal Neoprene Toe Warmers
customer_reviews.text: Nice concept and execution. If you or your friends have constantly cold feet, use these to slip your feet into and then wear your socks or stockings. Keeps your feet warm. Like wearing those half socks and it comes two to a package. RECOMMEND: Buy.
customer_reviews.author: Allen NakagawaTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Not much effect
customer_reviews.text: The idea for these is great, but in practice, they made very little difference on my toes. Some, but so little that I don't bother to use them. That's for my particular feet - for others, they apparently work great. I can't recommend, however.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: These were bought as a gift. My family works in a factory where they have to wear steel toe boots. They love them. They keep their toes warm even in all the cold winter conditions. They are a great length for all size feet.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: Kept my toes warm!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and kept my toes warm on a chilly windy bike ride (45-55 degrees). Fit nicely over socks.
customer_reviews.author: Trish Lieberman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointed in these, didn't keep toes that warm
customer_reviews.text: This is a good concept, but in the end, a second pair of thick socks worked better to keep the toes warm. If your body is cold it will still drain heat from the toes. Also they get sweaty after awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Great protection from steel toe shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Durable, using over thick Carhartt hiking socks to protect my toes from mandatory steel toe shoes. Best protection I’ve found so far from corns and damaged toes. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Warm tootsies ~ highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I always have cold toes. Plus I work in a shop environment and am on concrete all day. I love these toe warmers. I wear them every day and they keep my tootsies warm. 2 pack is great. Wash and dry one, wear the other pair.
customer_reviews.author: Vivid

customer_reviews.title: These Toe Warmers are Toe Savers!
customer_reviews.text: These toe warmers do exactly what I hoped they would: they keep my toes warm when I'm out walking in the cold, damp Upper Left Corner. They are simple and don't require me to wrap heavy batteries around my calves. They are shaped to match the curve of my toes so they don't bunch up inside my shoes. Simple. Perfect. They deliver. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: me3525

customer_reviews.title: Actually works!
customer_reviews.text: I have several health conditions and one of my issues is extremely cold feet. Once my feet get cold my entire body starts to hurt. I put these on and that pain was totally avoided. So very thankful.
customer_reviews.author: Gk

customer_reviews.title: Neat idea
customer_reviews.text: For me who works outside all day every day I look for new innovations like this. For the price I'll give them a try. I've always used them layering. My feet still get cold working in the elements but it does take longer. My work boots are composite toe. There a good idea in principle but not enough for a guy who's outside all day. I still layer with them every day so please dont think this is a horrible buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rianna

customer_reviews.title: Helped keep toes warm
customer_reviews.text: These worked pretty well to not only keep our toes warm but also dry. They are thin and comfortable in our shoes. I wish they were a little warmer but they work better than thick socks that make your shoes too tight.
customer_reviews.author: S. Richerson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps goes toasty in motocross and hunting boots
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my motocross boots during the winter. Works great. I started using them in my hunting boots after I seen how well they work.
customer_reviews.author: Katie T

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: Finally, no more cold toes! Performed better than anticipated! Will be purchasing more
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: Smells horrible
customer_reviews.text: These smell like A CAR TIRE. I’d think most people would hate this smell. The material doesn’t feel like rubber atleast but it also feels nothing like a sock either.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Kaminsky

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t tried them for winter bicycle commuting yet but the fit is perfect for under or over socks.
customer_reviews.author: Guy with feet

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled to find something that works for my feet with Reynaud's...and I have found it! I love how they fit under your other socks and are not very thick to interfere with the sizing of your shoes. I have work these with both dress socks and wool socks and they did not disappoint either way! I will definitely be purchasing more of these to get me through this Iowa fall and winter :)
customer_reviews.author: Tara L Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Reynauds sufferers will love them.
customer_reviews.text: The product works great. I bought the small size and even those will quickly wiggle off of my Mens Size 10 feet if allowed to. I put them under socks and that keeps them in place. Reynauds suffers will love these.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor and get this if you have Raynaud's!
customer_reviews.text: I have been having really bad Raynaud's episodes in my toes every evening after school. Homework is sometimes difficult to do and studying is especially hard to complete when my toes are itching and burning. I've been wearing these for only a few days so far yet I can't wait to share what I think of these. They're awesome, I put them on after school and forget that I even have Raynaud's. I recommend this to anyone with Raynaud's.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We really like the warmth that comes from wearing the toe warmers. They aren't super breathable so your feet start sweating a bit if you wear them too much, but they do their job otherwise. They came at the appointed time and are in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I am outside 4hrs a day, 5 days a week, in the mornings. I have the low-blood-flow of a type 1 Diabetic (since 1990). I live in Columbus, Ohio, where temps were pretty low (into negatives) most of last week. These kept my toes very comfortable - they made a huge difference - they kept that freeze on the outside of my work boots. I am quite impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Nellie Ellin

customer_reviews.title: Annoying!
customer_reviews.text: Helped keep my toes warm but added too much bulk to fit in some shoes. Had trouble keeping them in place while putting my shoes on at times. Overall a frustrating experience.
customer_reviews.author: John Carleton

customer_reviews.title: Wear @ your on risk
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money when wearing steel toes boots in the cold. While sitting around in a cold lunch tent they worked good!
customer_reviews.author: Kisha McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: These work!
customer_reviews.text: These Toe Warmers work great. I’ve been using the disposable 8hr Toe Warmers for over a year. I will definitely be saving money by using these Neoprene Toe Warmers.
customer_reviews.author: Trying_Healthy

customer_reviews.title: OK but not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Seller sent these as promised so nothing bad on their end. I just didn't care for the product. It's a little uncomfortable for my tastes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good warming, but...
customer_reviews.text: These did help keep my toes warmer even with reynaud's, but they just simply do not stay put.
customer_reviews.author: MsWendyB

customer_reviews.title: Not for high activity that causes sweating.
customer_reviews.text: Initially very warm but when I cross country ski or fat bike , and my feet sweat, they get colder than without these..... not breathable enough for perspiration evaporation.
customer_reviews.author: Maplemom

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Put the on bare foot, put over sock on foot still did not work.
customer_reviews.author: A T

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea
customer_reviews.text: My friend works outside, and his toes get cold in the winter. He really likes these.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for cold exposed toes
customer_reviews.text: We used these to keep my son’s toes warm while he was in a cast. They worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn S.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps toes warm,
customer_reviews.text: Just received today & already can tell a difference in my warmth. I suffer from chilblains every winter season, and I can tell these are going to be great for keeping toes at a consistent temp. One issue is that my feet are very slender so it doesn’t feel as tight on my foot.
customer_reviews.author: mnaylor

customer_reviews.title: Okay, not that effective in cold weather
customer_reviews.text: When its cold have to wear 2 on each foot with 2 pairs ofwool socks. But feet still get cold:/
customer_reviews.author: Susiec80

customer_reviews.title: These work really well
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised at how well these work. They're definitely too big for me to wear under socks (adult male size 10 feet, I got the large) - but they work great over socks.
customer_reviews.author: AberrantRambler

customer_reviews.title: Toasty toes
customer_reviews.text: My toes are cold all the time. These toe warmers really help! They fit nicely in my boots/shoes and I don't add extra bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Good for Raynauds
customer_reviews.text: My partner has raynauds and these helped his feet stay warm in the winter!
customer_reviews.author: Danny B.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't make a difference. My toes are still frozen😣 I was very hopeful this would allow me to wear cute shoes in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda F.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, and a good insulator on coolish days. Also work well as a pad to protect my Tailor's Bunion (pinky toe). Without these many rides are agonizing after 25+ miles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Raynauds syndrome
customer_reviews.text: Finally something to keep my toes warm. Just came back from lots of snow skiing in Utah and my toes were great. Few times wore over ski socks only and very cold days wore with toe warmer over ski sock then Neoprene warmers. Thumps up from me...:)
customer_reviews.author: Wyman M.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: If your toes get cold this product really does work
customer_reviews.author: James Hughson

customer_reviews.title: Great for chronic cold toes.
customer_reviews.text: They keep my cold raynauds feet nice and toasty warm.
customer_reviews.author: risha saperstein

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Well these did not help at ALL with my toes in the cold. Ended up leaving the event. I will buy Hot Hands toe warmers from now on
customer_reviews.author: Paula Martin

customer_reviews.title: Makes shoes too tight
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I should have ordered the small size..I don't know, but my shoes are too tight with these warmers inserted.
customer_reviews.author: SusanTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: I have Raynaud's
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about these, BUT THEY WORK!! We went snow skiing in Colorado during December and my toes never got cold or numb. I highly recommend these! Now if I could just find something just as good for my hands! These are a must!!
customer_reviews.author: Parker Liddell

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: They help keep your feet warm, haven’t had any issues with them yet
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my grandpa who is suffering from cold toes, he loves them, he even sleep with them on
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Barreñada

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome as a skier. Good bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Melang

customer_reviews.title: Do not stay on
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend these toe warmers, they do not stay on. One must have warm toes before these will work. May work under socks for sleeping...
customer_reviews.author: `CW ABQ, NM

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: As expected to keep toes warm while sleeping. Needs cover sock to keep on feet however.
customer_reviews.author: P Richard Pierce

customer_reviews.title: I love them!
customer_reviews.text: My ever-cold diabetic toes are so warm! I'll be buying more pairs
customer_reviews.author: W. Ungren

customer_reviews.title: Great toe warmers
customer_reviews.text: These are great under my socks when I go fly fishing. They are the extra little warmth I need to be able to fish in the cold water longer!
customer_reviews.author: SuzyQ

customer_reviews.title: Did just what I wanted them to do
customer_reviews.text: I have Reynaud's and when I walk my toes get terribly cold...these did as promised. Kept the heat in and let me walk in all kinds of weather. They did not add bulk and I wear them under my sneakers and even in dress boots best purchase
customer_reviews.author: AFL

customer_reviews.title: Still cold...
customer_reviews.text: I have Raynauds and read the reviews before purchasing. I had high hopes but these do not keep my feet warm. I was still numb for hours with these on
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: toe warmers
customer_reviews.text: liked the product alot , kept my toes warm this winter . I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Try these if you want to keep your toes in the cold.
customer_reviews.text: I love how it kept my toes nice and toasty at work in the cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Keeps toes warm. You don’t feel the seam which is the most important part for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thin but warm
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my toes warm but does make them sweat. Wear with socks. Nice to have 2 to change daily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn them once, but they really worked! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: E2Mom

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I am a size 6 and the small fit perfectly. Kept my toes warm while playing paddle tennis in 28 degrees. Usually my toes get numb within 30 min. I was out for an hour and a half and feet felt fine!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Keeps toes warm
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my fathers toes warm. He has poor circulation in toes.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew David

customer_reviews.title: Neoprene Toe Warmers
customer_reviews.text: These toe warmers are working great and are very well made I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Works well for such a simple concept
customer_reviews.text: Easy to wear. No bulky build up under you toes.
customer_reviews.author: MadPage

product_meta.title: 21C 1.5mm Neoprene Toe Warmers (Wear Inside Shoes) - 2 Pairs - 4 Foot Warmer Booties for Cycling, Hiking, Camping - Thermal Toe Socks - 2 Black
product_meta.description:
Don't let cold toes stop you from enjoying the outdoors! When you go outside on a cold day, your body restricts blood flow to the extremities to preserve heat (temperature) for the vital organs, and your toes, fingers, ears, and nose get cold first.

Our 21C Toe Warmers are the ultimate socks for your toes, and are designed to provide both comfort and insulation. A must have if you suffer from Raynaud's disease, neuropathy, or if your feet are always cold.

You get 2 Pairs and they come in 2 Sizes, because one size fits all doesn't work with feet! To pick the perfect fit, please make sure you measure the width of your foot and use the guide below. (Since they are just for the toes and ball of foot, how wide are your feet is more important than your shoe size.)

SIZE GUIDE:

SIZE 1: Women 6-8 Men 8-10

SIZE 2: Women 8.5-12 Men 10.5-14

MEASUREMENTS:

SIZE 1: Length 5 inches - Opening Width 4 inches

SIZE 2: Length 5.7 inches - Opening Width 4.7 inches

 Backed by 21 Century Solutions 100% satisfaction guarantee or your money back! If you have any issues with your toe warmers please contact us and we will get the problem solved ASAP!
feature_bullets: ULTRA THIN AND COMFORTABLE. Thin enough to put inside your shoes without adding bulk, and keep your toes warm and comfy. Can be worn in sneakers, ski boots, athletic shoes, slippers without being too tight (unlike wearing thicker socks or double socks that cover the entire foot and use more room).

1.5MM NEOPRENE BLEND FOR SUPERIOR INSULATION. Thick enough to keep your feet warm. They work like a wet suit, and keep body heat in. Re-enforced seams and entry for stability. Waterproof and windproof. 90% neoprene 10% nylon.
2 SIZES FOR PROPER FIT. Your true size is based not only on shoe size, but also your toe width. Please check the toe covers measurements and fit guide below to pick the right booties for your feet.
CONVENIENT PACK OF 2 PAIRS. Wear them over or under socks. Multiple uses. Ideal for hiking, climbing, cycling, skiing, snowboarding, gardening, walking, hunting, fishing, outdoor sporting events...
REUSABLE. More environmentally friendly than disposable toe warmers. Reuse them over and over. Wash them in cold water (hand wash or machine gentle cycle) and hang them to air dry.
